matched.actualTitle: Default Credentials Vulnerability in Login Form
matched.matchReason: Both findings identify the same vulnerability: hardcoded test:test credentials that allow unauthorized authentication. The actual finding provides detailed POC evidence showing successful login with test:test credentials and the HTML comment TODO indicating developer awareness of the issue.

missed.title: Server-Side Template Injection in Loan Calculator
missed.reason: The expected SSTI vulnerability in the total_loan_payments endpoint via unsanitized principal parameter was not identified in the actual pentest findings. While multiple calculation bypass vulnerabilities were found (negative values, double negatives, scientific notation, extreme values), none specifically identified SSTI through template injection in the principal parameter or render_template_string usage. The vulnerability may exist but was not discovered or tested for during this engagement.

extra.title: Calculation Logic Bypass - Negative Payment Values Accepted
extra.assessment: New discovery - Business logic vulnerability where negative payment values are accepted without validation, resulting in negative total loan calculations. This represents a gap in input validation that was not in the expected findings list but is a legitimate security issue requiring remediation.

extra.title: Calculation Logic Bypass - Negative Term Values Accepted
extra.assessment: New discovery - Similar to negative payment values, the endpoint accepts negative term values without validation. This is a business logic flaw that enables fraudulent loan scenarios with impossible loan terms.

extra.title: Horizontal Privilege Escalation - IDOR in Profile Update
extra.assessment: New discovery - Critical IDOR vulnerability allowing authenticated users to modify other users' profile data by manipulating user_id parameter. This represents unauthorized access control failure with significant business impact.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Profile Update Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - Profile update operations lack CSRF token validation, allowing attackers to trick authenticated users into modifying their profiles through malicious websites.

extra.title: Authentication Bypass via Whitespace in Credential
extra.assessment: New discovery - Authentication mechanism accepts credentials with trailing whitespace (test with space authenticates like test), potentially bypassing brute-force protections that track exact credentials.

extra.title: Case Insensitive Username Authentication Bypass
extra.assessment: New discovery - Login form performs case-insensitive username comparison, allowing case variations of the same username to authenticate. This increases attack surface for rate-limiting bypasses.

extra.title: Missing Secure and SameSite Flags on Session Cookie
extra.assessment: New discovery - Session cookies lack Secure and SameSite attributes, creating vulnerabilities to interception over HTTP and CSRF attacks despite having HttpOnly flag.

extra.title: Missing Brute Force Protection - No Rate Limiting on Login Attempts
extra.assessment: New discovery - No rate limiting, account lockout, CAPTCHA, or progressive delays on login attempts. 10 rapid failed attempts all processed successfully, enabling brute force attacks.

extra.title: Missing Critical Security Headers
extra.assessment: New discovery - Application missing X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Strict-Transport-Security, and Content-Security-Policy headers. These provide defense-in-depth against clickjacking, MIME sniffing, and XSS.

extra.title: Information Disclosure - IDOR in Profile Retrieval (GET Request)
extra.assessment: New discovery - GET requests to /profile accept user_id parameter and return other users' profile data without authorization checks. This enables read-based IDOR and user enumeration attacks.

extra.title: Input Validation Bypass - Empty Principal Parameter Accepted
extra.assessment: New discovery - Inconsistent input validation where principal parameter accepts empty values while payment and term properly reject empty values. This represents validation bypass through inconsistent controls.

extra.title: Unauthorized Modification of Loan Amount Parameter
extra.assessment: New discovery - Critical business logic vulnerability allowing users to arbitrarily modify their loan_amount field after initial creation. This enables borrowers to fraudulently reduce obligations or increase unwarranted credits.

extra.title: Information Disclosure - IDOR in Home Dashboard
extra.assessment: New discovery - /home endpoint accepts user_id parameter and displays other users' personalized dashboard content without authorization checks, enabling cross-user information gathering.

extra.title: Negative Value Injection in Loan Parameters
extra.assessment: New discovery - Endpoint accepts negative values for loan_amount, loan_term_months, and monthly_payment without validation. Creates severe business logic corruption enabling fraudulent reverse loans.

extra.title: Calculation Logic Bypass - Double Negative Values Cancel Out
extra.assessment: New discovery - Sophisticated bypass where providing both negative payment and negative term results in positive total (negative Ã— negative = positive), circumventing negative value detection.

extra.title: Improper Cache Control Header on User Data Pages
extra.assessment: New discovery - Sensitive user data pages use Cache-Control: public instead of private, allowing shared caches and proxies to cache user-specific information, creating information disclosure risk.

extra.title: Extreme Value Injection - Unbounded Loan Amount Limits
extra.assessment: New discovery - Application lacks upper bound validation, accepting billion-dollar loan amounts and 80+ year loan terms. Enables creation of nonsensical loan scenarios and potential fraud.

extra.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability in Login Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - Login endpoint lacks CSRF token validation and accepts requests from cross-origin sources. Enables attacker to trick users into logging into specific accounts through malicious websites.

extra.title: Loan Payment Validation Bypass - Mismatched Payment Amounts
extra.assessment: New discovery - Critical business logic vulnerability where monthly_payment, loan_amount, and loan_term_months have no mathematical validation. Users can create fraudulent loans where payment * term doesn't match principal.

extra.title: Scientific Notation Parsing Enables Extreme Value Bypass
extra.assessment: New discovery - Application transparently parses scientific notation (1e10, 1e20) without format validation, enabling attackers to bypass decimal-based validation through compact notation.
